title: 'Go out and do it again': Wolves return to WCF
content: The Timberwolves are back in the Western Conference finals for the second straight year after closing out the Warriors with a 121-110 win in Game 5 on Wednesday night.

title: Warriors had title shot if Curry healthy, Kerr says
content: The Warriors credited the Wolves and avoided excuses but acknowledged the impact of injuries to Stephen Curry and Jimmy Butler as their season ended.

title: Eagles-Chiefs rematch in W2 as NFL sked unveiled
content: A rematch of Super Bowl LIX between the Philadelphia Eagles and Kansas City Chiefs will take place in Week 2 of the NFL season.

title: Johnson's Bears debut vs. Vikes opens MNF slate
content: The 2025 "Monday Night Football" schedule kicks off with an NFC North showdown between the Vikings and Bears on Sept. 8, when Ben Johnson makes his head coaching debut for Chicago.

title: Refocused Celtics lean on D, Kornet to stay alive
content: The Celtics used a reinvigorated defense and the unlikely breakout of backup big man Luke Kornet to keep their season alive and send this playoff series against the Knicks back to New York for Game 6 on Friday.

title: Kapanen's OT winner propels Oilers to West finals
content: Kasperi Kapanen scored on a scramble in front of the net at 7:14 of overtime, and the Edmonton Oilers beat the Vegas Golden Knights 1-0 in Game 5 on Wednesday night to advance to the Western Conference finals for the second year in a row.

title: Reds celebrate Rose day after MLB reinstatement
content: Pete Rose was honored by the Reds on Wednesday night, a day after he was posthumously removed from MLB's permanent ineligibility list.

title: Madrid's Asencio may be charged for explicit video
content: Real Madrid defender Ra√∫l Asencio and three former teammates from the club's youth teams could face criminal charges for allegedly recording sexual images of a woman and a minor and distributing them without their consent.

title: Creativity shines as NFL teams unveil schedules
content: The 2025 NFL schedule was released Wednesday, prompting unique reveals by multiple teams on social media.

title: The 49ers are back! Trouble for the Cowboys! Let's overreact to the NFL schedule reveal
content: Will the 49ers roll into the playoffs? Can the Giants, Lions and Cowboys overcome tough slates? Let's size up schedule reveal fallout.

title: Updated 2025 MLB draft rankings: Top 150 prospects -- and a mini-mock draft
content: The race for the No. 1 overall pick is wide open. Here's who your team could be targeting this summer.

title: How Alex Bregman is adjusting to life in a new clubhouse
content: The longtime face of the Astros is now tearing it up for the Red Sox -- while his future remains uncertain.

title: New NBA mock draft: We project all 59 picks
content: With the Mavericks winning the lottery and the right to draft Cooper Flagg, here's our updated two-round mock.

content: Let's reason on why the Bears didn't improve at RB, why the Steelers didn't plan better at QB and why the Bengals didn't extend Trey Hendrickson (yet).

content: The 2024 WNBA rookies had a historic impact. What should we expect from the likes of Angel Reese and Caitlin Clark in Year 2?

title: A-Rod among well-wishers on Jayson Tatum's postsurgery Instagram post
content: The star forward recently completed surgery on his right Achilles tendon that was ruptured on Monday.

title: Jayson Tatum's injury timeline and what to learn from other NBA stars' Achilles tears
content: Following Tatum's devastating Achilles injury Monday, what has recovery looked like for other NBA stars?

title: How could the GOP tax bill affect sports teams?
content: A new tax plan that aims to curb breaks for team owners could lead to increased costs for fans, experts say.

title: Premier League Rookie of the Year: Ranking the best new U19 players
content: The Premier League Rookie of the Year award doesn't exist, but it should. Here are the young players who would be in the running for the 2024-25 prize.

title: Grading how every Big Ten men's basketball team performed in 2024-25
content: Rutgers' star duo fell short of expectations while Wisconsin's John Tonje helped the Badgers surpass theirs.

title: Rested, recharged, stronger than ever: How Fever's Caitlin Clark used offseason to reset
content: When cameras weren't catching her hanging with Taylor Swift, Caitlin Clark honed her game on the court and in the weight room.

title: Arsenal's new 2025-26 home kit will get fans' hearts racing
content: The beat of the human heart is the inspiration behind Arsenal's unveiling of their new home jersey for the 2025-26 season.

title: Sources: Man City eye Wirtz as Liverpool look on
content: Manchester City are pushing to sign Florian Wirtz but face stiff competition from Bayern Munich, a source has told ESPN.

title: NWSL players call for changes after King collapse
content: The NWSL Players Association said that play should have been stopped in the game between Angel City FC and the Utah Royals on Friday following the nearly 10-minute delay to provide medical attention to Savy King.

title: Bologna win Coppa Italia as Pulisic, Milan fall short
content: Dan Ndoye's second-half strike earned Bologna a hard-fought 1-0 victory over AC Milan in the Coppa Italia final on Wednesday to secure their first major trophy in 51 years.

title: Tottenham's Son files blackmail complaint in Seoul
content: Tottenham Hotspur captain Son Heung-min has filed a complaint to South Korean police alleging he was the victim of a blackmail attempt, his agency said on Thursday, after media reports that a woman had threatened him with a false pregnancy claim.

title: Tillman puts PSV on title brink as Ajax collapse
content: Ajax Amsterdam relinquished top spot in the Dutch league to PSV Eindhoven on the penultimate match day on Wednesday after they were held to a 2-2 draw following a late equaliser by Groningen.

title: Winless Galaxy squander lead, lose 10th of season
content: Tai Baribo scored two goals, including the game winner in the sixth minute of second-half stoppage time, as the Philadelphia Union rallied for a 3-2 victory Wednesday while keeping the Los Angeles Galaxy winless on the season.

title: MLS bans Rosales 3 games for discrimination
content: Minnesota United midfielder Joseph Rosales received a three-game ban from Major League Soccer after being found to have violated the MLS-MLSPA Joint Non-Discrimination Policy.

title: The UFC 317 and 319 title fights have big implications for the future
content: Pound-for-pound mainstays litter the main cards of UFC 317 and UFC 319, which means action is on the docket for sure.

title: 2025 NFL schedule analysis: Projections, odds, players to upgrade and downgrade
content: The friendliest and toughest slates in fantasy, who makes the NFL playoffs and the race for the No. 1 pick in 2026.

title: What to know ahead of Imola
content: What to know as Formula 1 heads to Imola at Autodromo Internazionale Enzo e Dino Ferrari for round seven of the 2025 season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Liverpool and Chelsea eye Jo√£o Pedro
content: Arsenal, Liverpool and Chelsea all have their eyes on Jo√£o Pedro as a summer target. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Op Sindoor: India demonstrated tech edge by beating Pak‚Äôs Chinese systems
content: India successfully conducted strikes against terror hubs, bypassing Pakistan's air defenses. The Indian Air Force also thwarted multiple retaliatory missile and drone attacks. Indigenous air defence network played a crucial role during the hostilities. The armed forces are on high alert, maintaining operational readiness. India is adhering to the bilateral understanding to cease military action.

title: Trump says India has offered a trade deal with ‚Äòliterally no tariffs‚Äô
content: Donald Trump has claimed India's proposal for a trade agreement with "no tariffs". This move comes as India seeks a trade deal with the U.S. amidst Trump's 90-day suspension of tariff increases, which previously included a 26% duty on Indian goods.

title: 'Rok sako to rok lo': Rahul's message to PM Modi, Nitish Kumar in Bihar
content: Rahul Gandhi faced police obstruction en route to Ambedkar hostel in Darbhanga, where he planned to engage with students at a 'Shiksha Nyay Samvad' event. Despite the attempts to stop him, Gandhi entered the premises and criticized the Bihar government as a "Double Engine Dhokebaaz Sarkaar," vowing to implement social justice measures if his party comes to power.

title: Melinda Gates on when she realised its time to end marriage with Bill Gates
content: Melinda French Gates revealed a recurring dream of standing on a crumbling cliff with Bill Gates and their children influenced her decision to divorce. This dream, along with surfacing information like Bill's association with Jeffrey Epstein, served as a catalyst. She also experienced panic attacks during the separation, highlighting the emotional toll of ending their 27-year marriage.

title: Rohit vs Virat: Former South Africa cricketer makes a huge statement
content: Herschelle Gibbs ignited a social media debate by asserting that Rohit Sharma possesses a superior technique compared to Virat Kohli. Gibbs emphasized Rohit's technical correctness, particularly his defensive prowess, while acknowledging Kohli's dominance and aggressive approach, especially in white-ball cricket. This comparison sparked considerable discussion among fans, contrasting the two Indian batting stalwarts.

title: Nifty50 crosses 25,000; BSE Sensex up over 1,200 points
content: ‚ÄãStock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Thursday afternoon after a volatile first half on hopes of an early trade deal with the US.

title: Sensex 1,200 points up: Top 5 reasons for bulls' party
content: Stock market today: Indian stock markets surged, with Nifty50 surpassing 25,000 and Sensex closing above 82,000, fueled by optimism surrounding potential US-India trade deals and declining oil and gold prices.

title: Zerodha's Nithin Kamath warns: ‚ÄòIndia is at the epicentre of the global‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath expressed concern over rising soft drink consumption in India, linking it to the country's diabetes epidemic. He highlighted alarming statistics, including the high risk for young adults and lack of awareness. Kamath emphasized the need for public awareness, insurance coverage, early detection programs, and lifestyle changes to combat this growing health crisis.

title: Neeraj Chopra speaks on relationship with Arshad Nadeem
content: Neeraj Chopra addressed his relationship with Arshad Nadeem. He mentioned the impact of India-Pakistan relations on their interactions. Chopra is set to compete in the Doha Diamond League. He will face strong competition from Anderson Peters and Jakub Vadlejch. Kishore Jena, another Indian athlete, will also participate. Chopra aims to reclaim the Doha DL title, having won it in 2023.

title: The real reason India‚Äôs getting tough on Donald Trump‚Äôs trade terms
content: India is escalating its trade disputes with the US, challenging tariffs at the WTO and signaling a shift from defense to offense. Inspired by China's tactics and triggered by Trump's claims of brokering a ceasefire with Pakistan, India asserts its strategic autonomy. New Delhi prioritizes signaling strength and diversifying trade relationships amid ongoing tensions with Washington.

title: Why NASA fired the employee it once celebrated and even went on to wipe her details
content: Following President Trump's inauguration, NASA removed diversity-focused content from its website, including Rose Ferreira's story about overcoming poverty to work at the agency. This action, led by acting administrator Janet Petro, involved firing DEIA employees, halting hires, and removing diversity references, creating a tense atmosphere and raising concerns about inclusivity at NASA.

title: 18 Haryana schools record 0% pass rate in Class 12 boards examination
content: The Haryana Board of School Education (HBSE) has flagged 100 underperforming schools, including 18 with a zero percent pass rate in the Class 12 board exams, to the Directorate of Education. The HBSE chairman, Dr. Pawan Kumar, emphasized the need for teacher training and engagement with students and parents to address the causes of the poor results and improve performance.

title: 'Don‚Äôt want you building in India': Trump‚Äôs clear message to Apple CEO to 'Make in US'
content: Donald Trump has expressed his disapproval to Tim Cook regarding Apple's increasing manufacturing presence in India, amidst the company's efforts to diversify away from China due to tariffs and diplomatic tensions. Trump wants Apple to increase manufacturing operations in the United States.

title: R Ashwin breaks silence on India‚Äôs Test captaincy debate
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has ignited debate over India's next Test captain, suggesting Jasprit Bumrah, a 'national treasure,' deserves consideration despite workload concerns. He also proposes Ravindra Jadeja as a short-term option, emphasizing the importance of consistent selection and mentoring a younger player like Shubman Gill. Ashwin advocates for a formal interview process to assess leadership qualities beyond on-field performance.

title: TMC MLA Tapas Saha dies of brain haemorrhage at Kolkata hospital
content: Trinamool Congress MLA Tapas Saha, representing Tehatta constituency in Nadia district, passed away at a Kolkata hospital due to a brain haemorrhage at the age of 66. Saha was admitted to the hospital after collapsing on Tuesday, but his condition deteriorated.

title: Why Kanye West's pro-Hitler song is illegal in Germany
content: Controversy surrounds Ye's new single. The song contains antisemitic content. It is banned on many platforms. However, it remains available on Elon Musk's X. This raises questions about content moderation policies. Other platforms like Spotify and YouTube removed the song. The debate highlights the challenges tech companies face. They struggle to remove the offensive content effectively.

title: Watch: Army conducts successful 'Teesta Prahar' exercise
content: The Indian Army conducted 'Teesta Prahar,' a field training exercise showcasing operational capabilities and coordination in river-based terrain, incorporating advanced weaponry and technology. Simultaneously, the Defence Research & Development Organisation (DRDO) has developed a domestic nanoporous membrane for high-pressure seawater desalination, successfully tested on Indian Coast Guard vessels. This innovation addresses stability concerns and supports the 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat' initiative.

title: Watch: Paris locals fight armed men kidnapping CEO‚Äôs pregnant daughter and her child
content: In Paris, the pregnant daughter of a crypto executive and her child were targeted in a kidnapping attempt. Masked assailants attacked, but locals intervened, thwarting the abduction. The victims sustained minor injuries, and the attackers fled in a fake delivery van.

title: 'Sinister intent': CM Stalin on President's letter to SC on guv verdict
content: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin has strongly criticized the Centre's Presidential reference regarding governors' powers, deeming it an attempt to undermine the Constitution and paralyze non-BJP state legislatures. He argues it subverts the Supreme Court's settled position on governors' roles and accuses the BJP of using governors to weaken democratically elected state governments.

title: Pope welcomes Sinner to Vatican
content: Pope Leo XIV, the new pontiff, is gaining attention as a sports enthusiast. He showed his love for baseball and tennis. Jannik Sinner, the world's top-ranked tennis player, visited the Pope Leo XIV. Sinner gifted him a racket and invited him to play. The Pope joked about Wimbledon's dress code. Sinner is preparing for his Italian Open quarterfinal match.

title: 'My way': How Virat Kohli's farewell story on Instagram becomes a testament to his career
content: Virat Kohli, India's beloved cricketer, retires from Test cricket, marking the end of an era defined by his 'My Way' approach. His fitness obsession, bold captaincy decisions like prioritizing pace bowling, and early adoption of social media shaped his career. Kohli leaves behind a legacy of records, brand endorsements, and iconic status, inspiring future generations with his leadership and determination.

title: 'Pak jahan khada hota hai ...': Rajnath tweaks Bachchan's dialogue to slam Islamabad
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, during his visit to Srinagar, took a jibe at Pakistan's economic woes, contrasting it with India's growing financial stature. He lauded the Army personnel for Operation Sindoor, emphasizing its necessity in combating Pakistan-sponsored terrorism. Singh also acknowledged the public's anger against terrorism following the Pahalgam attack, praising the forces for their actions across the border.

title: Gambhir, first batch of India Test squad likely to leave for England on June 6
content: Gautam Gambhir and the initial group of Test players are scheduled to depart for England on June 6, with subsequent departures contingent on IPL 2025 commitments. Gambhir will concentrate on preparing the Test squad, while support staff may join the team directly in England. The India A squad's departure will also be staggered, commencing on May 25.

title: How much prize money did Team India earn in World Test Championship 2023-25?
content: Despite missing the World Test Championship final, India secured a substantial USD 1.44 million for finishing third in the 2023-25 cycle. The ICC announced a record USD 5.76 million prize pool, with Australia and South Africa set to compete for the top prize at Lord's. India, led by Rohit Sharma, won nine out of 19 matches in the cycle.

title: At $329 billion, Tamil Nadu about to overtake Pakistan's GDP
content: Over the past two decades, Pakistan's economic lead over Indian states like Tamil Nadu and Maharashtra has diminished significantly. In 2004-05, Pakistan's GDP was $132 billion, while Tamil Nadu's GSDP was only $48 billion. By 2023-24, Tamil Nadu's GSDP has nearly equaled Pakistan's GDP, reaching $329 billion, highlighting a growing economic divergence.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma leave for Bengaluru ahead of IPL restart
content: Following his surprising Test retirement, Virat Kohli is gearing up for the resumption of IPL 2025, spotted with wife Anushka Sharma en route to Bengaluru. Kohli, having recently visited Vrindavan, now shifts his focus to leading Royal Challengers Bengaluru's batting line-up as they prepare to host Kolkata Knight Riders on Saturday.

title: Genelia Deshmukh says working with Aamir Khan in ‚ÄòSitaare Zameen Par‚Äô feels ‚Äòspecial‚Äô
content: Genelia Deshmukh is making a comeback with Aamir Khan in 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. She describes the role as special. Aamir plays a basketball coach training intellectually disabled children. The film explores themes of growth and acceptance. It features ten new young actors. Aamir Khan returns to acting after a break. The movie is set to release on June 20.

title: 'Exercise restraint': SC slams minister for 'irresponsible' remarks on Col. Sofiya Qureshi
content: The Supreme Court reprimanded Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah for his "irresponsible" remarks about Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, emphasizing that individuals in constitutional roles must exercise caution, especially during sensitive operations like Operation Sindoor. Shah's comments, suggesting the Prime Minister sent a "terrorists' sister" to harm them, led to widespread condemnation and a High Court order for an FIR against him.

title: Rahul Gandhi stopped by police from entering Ambedkar hostel in Bihar's Darbhanga
content: In Darbhanga, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi faced police obstruction while attempting to enter Ambedkar hostel for the ‚ÄòShiksha Nyay Samvad‚Äô with students. Local authorities denied entry, leading to protests from Bihar Congress leaders. The administration reportedly shifted the venue, but Congress insisted on the original location.

title: Bollywood actor-director Tinu Anand gets flak for his threat to beat strays
content: Veteran Bollywood director Tinu Anand faces backlash from animal lovers after threatening to harm stray dogs in his Mumbai neighborhood. Anand's WhatsApp message, expressing fear and anger towards barking dogs, included a threat to beat them with a hockey stick.

title: At 91, retired oil executive gets PhD & D Litt from Andhra University
content: At 91, Dr. NS Dhanam continues his lifelong pursuit of knowledge, recently earning a D.Litt. from Vietnam National University after a PhD at 81. A former corporate leader, he turned to academics post-retirement. Passionate about philosophy and scriptures, he stays physically and mentally active in Bengaluru, emphasizing the importance of learning and fitness throughout life

title: Backlash for support to Pak: Indians cancel trips to Turkey
content: Following public outcry and boycott calls against Turkey and Azerbaijan due to their stance during recent India-Pakistan tensions, travel bookings have plummeted. Major platforms like MakeMyTrip and Cleartrip report significant booking drops and cancellation surges.

title: I-scream! Ahmedabad woman finds lizard tail in ice cream cone
content: A Maninagar resident, Bhavika Tilwani, experienced a horrifying incident after discovering a lizard's tail in her ice cream cone, leading to her hospitalization. Following the complaint, the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation sealed Mahalaxmi Corner ice cream parlour and penalized Havmor Ice Cream Pvt Ltd Rs 50,000.

title: Pak went running to try to achieve ceasefire like scared dog: Ex-Pentagon official
content: Michael Rubin stated that Pakistan hastily sought a ceasefire after India effectively countered its missile and drone attacks. He highlighted India's precise strikes on terror infrastructure within Pakistan and PoK, which successfully neutralized Pakistan's retaliatory efforts. Rubin emphasized that India's diplomatic victory lies in shifting global focus onto Pakistan's support for terrorism, exposing the deep ties between the Pakistani military and terrorist organizations.

title: IPL 2025 playoffs scenarios explained: Who needs to do what to qualify
content: Following a brief interruption, the IPL is set to resume on May 17, with Mumbai Indians, Delhi Capitals, Kolkata Knight Riders and Lucknow Super Giants vying for the final playoff spot. MI and DC are in a strong position, while KKR and LSG face an uphill battle. Chennai Super Kings, Rajasthan Royals, and Sunrisers Hyderabad have been eliminated from contention.

title: Muslim man allowed to have multiple wives if he can treat them equally: Allahabad HC
content: The Allahabad High Court has stated that Muslim men can marry more than once if they treat all wives equally, referencing Quranic permission for polygamy under specific conditions. This ruling came during a case involving Furkan, accused of bigamy and rape for marrying without disclosing his existing wife. The court dismissed the charges, acknowledging Muslim law allows multiple wives, and ordered further investigation while protecting Furkan from coercive action.

title: Gold rate today: Gold prices down Rs 7,900 per 10 grams from record highs
content: Gold rate today: Gold and silver prices faced a decline in the Multi Commodity Exchange. Safe haven demand decreased due to US-China trade discussions. Experts suggest precious metal prices will remain volatile.

title: 'We've lost trust in men': Deceived by husbands, 2 UP women ‚Äòmarry‚Äô each other
content: In Bareilly, two women, Asha (Golu) and Jyoti, both deceived about their husbands' religious identities, have forged an unconventional bond. Estranged from family and societal norms, they found solace in shared experiences and decided to "marry" in a temple ceremony.

title: 'I need ...': Prithvi Shaw shares cryptic post ahead of IPL resumption
content: Prithvi Shaw's recent social media activity has stirred discussions. He posted a cryptic message before the Indian Premier League resumes. Shaw's career has faced challenges with form and fitness. He was dropped from Mumbai's team and went unsold in the IPL auction. Shashank Singh suggested Shaw improve his lifestyle. The message raises questions about Shaw's next steps.

title: ‚ÄòSpeak in Marathi or we won‚Äôt pay‚Äô: Quarrel over pizza delivery turns into language row
content: A pizza delivery dispute occurred in Bhandup. It involved Vaidehi Pathak and delivery boy Rohit Lavera. The argument started over pizza quality. It then shifted to the use of Marathi language. Pathak insisted Lavera speak Marathi. Lavera, a native of Haryana, refused. MNS intervened, and Lavera apologized. Police have registered a non-cognisable offence and are investigating the matter.

title: Bangladesh to get $1.3bn from IMF; seeks $762m augmentation in support
content: Bangladesh has requested an additional $762 million from the IMF, potentially increasing total assistance to $4.1 billion. This request comes as the nation faces macroeconomic challenges, including slowed GDP growth and persistent inflation. The IMF's support is contingent upon Bangladesh undertaking critical reforms, such as exchange rate liberalization and tax improvements, to ensure financial stability.

title: IUML to remain in DMK alliance in T.N. and UDF in Kerala, says party‚Äôs national president Kader Mohideen
content: IUML national general secretary and Deputy Leader of the Opposition in the Kerala Legislative Assembly P.K. Kunhalikutty said the party will continue to work with ‚Äúsecular parties‚Äù

content: Reconstitution of the Expert Committee to identify forest lands within the State was recommended by the CEC

content: ‚ÄúThe scam was unearthed in Atarasi village under the Panwasa block of Sambhal district, Uttar Pradesh,‚Äù officials said

content: The Chief Minister stressed the need for officials to continuously monitor the status of agreements signed with various companies in order to translate them into reality in a time-bound manner

title: Ex-Union Minister John Barla joins TMC, claims BJP did not allow him to work for tribals
content: I believe under the leadership of Mamata Banerjee, I will be able to do justice to the cause of the tribal population, says former Union Minister John Barla

title: Maharashtra signs ‚Çπ5127 crores MoU for developing multimodal logistics hubs
content: Maharashtra government partners with Blackstone to develop modern logistics and industrial parks, attracting FDI and creating job opportunities

title: No radiation leak from any nuclear facility in Pakistan: IAEA
content: Air Marshal A. K. Bharti rejected suggestions that India hit Kirana Hills, home to Pakistan's nuclear installations

title: Free career counselling by The Hindu Group for students in Kalaburagi on May 18
content: The programme aims to provide much-needed academic and career guidance to students exploring options in higher education and competitive examinations

title: Effluent treatment plant at dyeing unit in Cuddalore SIPCOT collapses, flooding neighbourhood; 19 hospitalised
content: The affected persons, mostly residents of Kudikadu Colony, suffered health complications, such as irritation in the eyes, nausea, and sudden sapping of energy

title: Army chief visits forward areas in Baramulla; lauds role of troops in Operation Sindoor
content: Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi praised troops for their dominance along the LoC during Operation Sindoor and their role in destroying terror camps in PoK

title: Rajnath Singh calls for global oversight of Pakistan‚Äôs nuclear arsenal, warns against ‚Äòblackmail‚Äô
content: On first visit to Kashmir post-Pahalgam attack, Defence Minister underscores India‚Äôs resolve against terrorism and lauds armed forces for Operation Sindoor

title: M.P. High Court slams police over contents of FIR against Vijay Shah; to monitor probe
content: The High Court had taken a sum moto cognizance of the matter on May 14, 2025, after Minister Shah‚Äôs inflammatory remarks about Colonel Sofia Qureshi

title: Badlapur encounter: Maharashtra DGP forms new SIT to probe custodial death of accused
content: Akshay Shinde, accused of assaulting two girls, was shot dead by police on September 23, 2024, after allegedly grabbing a cop‚Äôs gun while being moved from Taloja jail

title: T.N. CM Stalin condemns Presidential reference on Supreme Court‚Äôs verdict imposing time frame for assent of Bills
content: The Chief Minister has urged all non BJP-ruled States to join legal struggle to defend the Constitution.

title: Liquor cost to go up from May 15 in Karnataka
content: An office-bearer of the Federation of Wine Merchants‚Äô Association of Karnataka said that excise duty has been hiked in the first four slabs that fixes the price for cheaper brands of IML

title: Kerala Chief Electoral Officer orders police probe against G. Sudhakaran over alleged 1989 postal ballot tampering
content: Rathan U. Kelkar says Election Commission of India has taken a serious view of media reports regarding Sudhakaran‚Äôs controversial statement in Alappuzha

title: Haryana women's commission has misread, misunderstood my posts: Sonipat varsity professor
content: The Haryana State Commission for Women had sent a notice to Mahmudabad on May 12, saying that a prima facie review of his social media posts reveal various concerns

title: Despite police ban, Rahul Gandhi reaches Ambedkar Hostel in Darbhanga
content: Congress leader was scheduled to interact with the SC, ST and OBC students; lashes out at Bihar police, Mr. Gandhi says that India is ‚Äúnot governed by dictatorship‚Äù

title: Kerala govt forms panel to look into demands of striking ASHA workers
content: Five-member committee to meet representatives of ASHAs organisations and trade union representatives and submit its report

title: Watch: Revanth Reddy highlights Centre-State disparity, seeks equity in resources
content: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy in conversation with Ravikanth Reddy titled ‚ÄòWhither Social Justice? Telangana‚Äôs bold governance experiment‚Äô¬†¬†

title: Indian national sentenced to three weeks‚Äô jail for molesting steward on flight
content: Rajat, who goes by only one name, pleaded guilty on Wednesday (May 14, 2025) to one charge of using criminal force with the intent to outrage modesty, The Straits Times said on Thursday (May 15, 2025)

title: CJI Gavai-led Bench to devote whole of May 20 to hear arguments on interim stay of 2025 waqf amendments¬†¬†
content: Chief Justice Gavai asked the lawyers to come prepared, submit a consolidated note of their submissions and points of law beforehand to ensure that the case is not adjourned

title: Delhi HC seeks NIA's stand on Engineer Rashid's bail plea in terror funding case
content: The bench also asked the NIA to respond to a separate plea by Rashid challenging the framing of charges in the case.

content: The Madras High Court wants to know if the producers will be willing to delete or mute objectionable portion¬†

content: Iranian cheetahs face threats owing to a decline in primary prey species, habitat loss and fragmentation, human-wildlife conflict

content: Pakistan‚Äôs ‚Äòpolite‚Äô letter to India for restarting talks on the IWT doesn‚Äôt mention air strikes or India‚Äôs surprise release of Baglihar-Salal water

title: Maharashtra govt. issues SOP to protect inter-faith, inter-caste couples¬†
content: On¬†April 29, 2025, the Bombay High Court received a draft of the GR from the State government saying that it would be dealing with safe house for inter faith and inter caste couples, both married and unmarried.¬†¬†

title: Nagmohan Das Commission considering changing names of certain Scheduled Caste communities that are used as cuss words in Karnataka
content: He pointed out that of the 186 scheduled castes and sub-castes, many of the names were given by the upper castes

title: Kerala government initiates operation to capture ‚Äòman-eating‚Äô tiger in Malappuram
content: Government declares alert in the locality and intensifies patrolling by police and Forest department‚Äôs rapid response squads

title: On Camera, Karnataka Man Stabs Teacher After Dispute Over Cricket Ball
content: An argument over whether a young man's cricket ball landed at his teacher's house took a violent turn when the former assaulted and stabbed the latter in Karnataka's Bagalkot district.

title: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE: Pak's Nuclear Weapons Should Be Brought Under Global Watch, Says Rajnath Singh
content: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE Updates: Pakistan's nuclear weapons should be brought under the supervision of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) as they are not safe in such a rogue nation, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said on Thursday.

title: Inside The Turkish Firm That Handles High-Security Tasks At Indian Airports
content: Turkey's decision to back Pakistan during the recent India-Pakistan stand-off has led to massive outrage against the West Asian nation.

title: Pakistan "Pleads" With India To Reconsider Indus Waters Treaty Suspension
content: Pakistan has reportedly written a letter to India, urging it to reconsider the decision to put the Indus Waters Treaty into abeyance.

title: "When Tharoor Saab Speaks...": Congress Sends A "Lakshman Rekha" Message
content: Flowers from foes, fire from friends -- this sums up what Congress leader Shashi Tharoor is going through these days. While the Thiruvananthapuram MP has drawn cheers from his critics for articulating India's position amid its tensions with Pakistan

title: No Radiation Leak From Any Nuclear Facility In Pakistan: Nuclear Watchdog IAEA
content: Global nuclear watchdog IAEA has said there was no radiation leak or release from any nuclear facility in Pakistan during the country's recent military conflict with India.

title: "Go And Apologise": Top Court To Minister Over Colonel Sofiya Qureshi Remark
content: The Supreme Court today sharply rebuked Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah over his controversial remarks directed at Indian Army officer Colonel Sofiya Qureshi.

title: "Are Nukes Safe With Pak?" Rajnath Singh Calls For International Supervision
content: Earlier this week, Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Punjab's Adampur air base and interacted with soldiers.

title: Trump Says US, Iran Close To Nuclear Deal: "They Sort Of Agreed To Terms"
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday said the United States was getting very close to securing a nuclear deal with Iran, as he warned Tehran that it was its only option to avoid military actions.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trump Is So, So Wrong In Lumping India And Pakistan Together
content: No doubt the Pahalgam assault was condemned by the US and others, but it means little from India's point of view if they did not take cognisance of Pakistan's role in it.

title: Sri Lankan Police Is Reviving Salt Contaminated Farms. Here's How
content: A commando in an elite Sri Lankan police unit, Sameera Dilshan has an unusual mission -- to reclaim farms poisoned by salt, a long-standing problem now accelerating due to climate change.

title: She Escaped An Avalanche. Then Became First Woman To Summit Mount Everest
content: Nearly 50 years ago, a Japanese Women's Everest Expedition (JWEE) team was on its way to climb Mount Everest, and it faced an avalanche.

title: World Court Prosecutor Used Gaza War To Silence Sex Assault Victim: Report
content: Karim Khan campaigned to become the ICC's chief prosecutor in 2020, with backing from then-Kenyan Deputy President William Ruto. He assumed office in June 2021.

title: Why The Moon's Two Sides Look So Different: Study Explains
content: An exhaustive examination of lunar gravity using data obtained by two NASA robotic spacecraft is offering new clues about why the two sides of the moon - the one perpetually facing Earth and the other always facing away - look so different.

title: Dior's Client Data Stolen In Cyberattack, Says "Informing Customers"
content: Dior did not say how many customers were involved but it insisted that no financial information, such as bank card numbers, were on the database accessed.

content: US authorities have charged a couple who allegedly forced a teenager to live in a dog cage and abused her for years.
